title: 1964 Chevrolet Impala

description: This 1964 Chevrolet Impala is offered to you for sale by Scottsdale Autos Online. Visit www.ScottsdaleAutosOnline.com for more pics, free Carfax and more info. Or stop by and visit our indoor, air-conditioned showroom. As always, Scottsdale Autos Online is your source for clean, no accident, low mile luxury cars in AZ! The tires on the vehicle appear to have been recently replaced. This vehicle has brand new tires. The paint has a showroom shine. This vehicle has all of the right options. With just 61,744 miles, this car is barely broken in. This was an extra vehicle for the previous owner and the mileage is consistent with its limited use. You won't find another vehicle like this with lower mileage! This car has successfully undergone a rigorous pre-buy inspection. The interior of this vehicle is virtually flawless. It seems that this vehicle was owned by a non-smoker. Neither the ashtray, nor the cigarette lighter, appear to have been used in this vehicle. The transmission in this vehicle shifts very smoothly. Very smooth ride! All electronic components in working condition. All interior components are in good working order. One of the most attractive color combinations available on a Impala! Competitively priced for a car in this condition. This is destined to be a classic. We offer free airport pick-up. We can help facilitate low-cost shipping directly to your door. At Scottsdale Autos Online, no matter what vehicle you are looking for, we can find it for you. Scottsdale Autos is excited to offer this 1964 Chevrolet Impala! At Scottsdale Autos Online, we strive to provide you with the best quality vehicles for the lowest possible price, and this Impala is no exception.

description: For sale in our Chicago showroom is this clean 1964 Chevrolet Impala SS.  Built in St Louis, MO, this car has managed to keep itself in Americas Midwest.  Unfortunately, the original engine was removed somewhere along the way, but a very healthy 350 cubic inch motor has made its way under the hood to make for a sporty ride once again.  Shifting gears is up to the driver, with the 4-speed manual gearbox tucked behind the engine.  Go ahead and put Ã¢??Your key to greater valueÃ¢?Â in the ignition and spin the starter to give life into the 5.7l V8.  The smooth rumble pops from the tailpipes as you cruise on down the road.  Complementing the slick silver exterior is this classy black vinyl interior.  Bits of chrome are splashed around the dash with spun aluminum panels making for a great mixture of sport and luxury.  The paint is still fresh, as it was laid down in 2013, and has had small upgrades since then, including new trim and moldings throughout 2014, new window cranks, door handles, and mirrors in 2015, as well as various other often overseen components to this classic.  With so much work done, you may be worried about driving it, but fear not, this baby is ready to take on the open road!The Impala has always been a great blend of class and sport, and this example is no exception.  Options include: AM Radio, Power Brakes, Power Steering, Rally Wheels with Radial Tires, Seat Belts, and a Vinyl Interior.  For more information on this beautiful 1964 Chevrolet Impala SS, contact our Chicago showroom at (708) 444-4488 or Chicago@GatewayClassicCars.com.  To see more HD photos and an HD video of the vehicle running and driving, visit www.GatewayClassicCars.com.

description: 1965 Chevrolet Impala almost completely restored.  Lots to list so I'll give a quick rundown:   Healthy 350 / 700r4, 12 bolt with 3:31 gears. Custom transmission cross member, front and rear suspension is completely redone, rear is boxed, front is tubular. Front also has disc brake conversion. All new brake lines and hand bent transmission lines. New wiring for engine bay and rear light harnesses. New interior with racing buckets. Custom grafted metal cowl hood and shaved nose valance. Pics show inner fender wells off, I have them, just not installed due to the suspension work. Call for details.

description: 1964 Chevy Impala SS. It has new 350ci crate motor with 600 Holley carburetor. The motor has aprox 1500 miles on it with 350 turbo automatic transmission. The car has been converted to power front disc brakes w/ dual master cylinder and vacuum booster. New rear brakes,  4 new coil Springs, new shocks. New A-frame bushings, tie rod ends, and front end alignment. New ball joints, new u-joints, new carrier bearing. New tires, new dual exhaust with glass packs. Upgraded, remote controlled stereo and amp and 10' sub woofers. New converted Internal regulated alternator. New power steering pump. Electric fan thermostat controlled Tachometer, under dash gauges. Mag wheels and new tires. Extra set of New tires and Chevy Rally Wheels & other misc parts. Dash has two cracks in it and carpet is a little faded. Some rust in the trunk and around the body and frame. The frame has been welded from a previous owner and it looks rough, functionally it works great but does not look pretty. Floor pans are in good condition. Seats and door panels are good looking and in good shape. The gauges work all except the clock in the dash. Runs good doesn't dog track drives straight. It has been garaged for the most part. Not a show car and not a race car but a fun driver/cruiser that runs good.
title: 1964 Chevrolet Impala

description: You stopped to look at this 1968 Chevrolet Impala because it's a great-looking hardtop at an affordable price.  But then when you see its been given all the right features â€“ from a comfy A/C interior to an enhanced small block â€“ you'll realize this is one of the best deals in classic cars today.

The squared-off roofline of this Impala is a bit different, and Chevy fans know this is something very special.  1968 was the first year for the Impala Custom Coupe.  This gave the Impala the same roofline as the top-dog Caprice, so to have it featured in black vinyl adds some prestige to the sporty appearance.  And for a car like this, the performance is a bit more subtle.  If you look at the pictures carefully, you'll be able to see the ghost SS-style dual stripes. They are just a shade lighter than the Grotto Blue.  And this factory-correct color steals the show all on its own with its deep luster that helps highlight the sharp edge curves on this Impala.  Because the brightwork is just as important, there has been work to make sure everything is just as shiny as the paint.   This includes re-chroming the front bumper, and the all-important rear one with that hallmark six taillight arrangement built into the design.

This dual luxury and performance attitude continues on the freshly restored interior.  The black bucket seats and the comfortable center console with iconic horseshoe shifter completes makes this feel like a true Super Sport.  A full-size car like this can comfortably carry up to five people with ease, so you get great features to keep everyone happy like an AM/FM stereo and ice-cold air conditioning running modern R134a.  But even when you're just cruising by yourself, this Impala is a great choice.  After all, you're going to love grabbing the three-spoke sports steering wheel and gazing at the classic speedometer that's as long as the horizon.  Plus, the pillarless profile that comes from rolling down all the windows on this premium hardtop is worth the price all on its own (and thanks to the A/C you can look cool while staying cool.)

You're going to want to grab your sunglasses before popping the hood.  That's because there's been a serious investment in plenty of polished components to grab attention away from even the bright orange block.  And when you look beyond the shine, you'll discover the substance of a performance-built and period-correct 327 cubic-inch V8.  It has been fortified with go-fast goodies such as a big four-barrel carburetor, Edelbrock EPS intake, headers, and a stainless performance X-pipe dual exhaust with a fantastic rumble.  And more than just performance components, there has been a solid investment in great cruising features, too.  The independent front suspension now features new urethane bushings and a thick front sway bar.  Combined with the stout three-speed automatic transmission and power steering, this Impala is a great all-around driver.
Complete with o

description: This 1969 Chevy Impala Convertible only has 80621 Miles on its odometer and is in excellent condition inside and out. Â It is powered by its 350 4bb 300 HP V8 engine and backed up by its automatic transmission. Â IT comes equipped with power steering power front disk brakes power windows power top factory air conditioning tilt wheel working am delco radio dual exhaust and is riding on its original 7 inch rally rims. Â Its dark green paint has been repainted once and still looks great. Â It has been buffed and polished to a great shine and has clean bumpers and chrome. Â Its silver green original interior looks fantastic still and really supports that this car only has 80k miles. Â In its glove box is its factory starting instructions protecto plate owners manual check out sheet dated 1969 and much more. Â This car is a true time capsule and is a great classic car investment grade car!
